CatDescriptText: Robert Lee Kyles, Homewood and Mrs. Ronald Bosco, Brentwood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe the people who vote only for the President every four years make the best citizens?"  Mr. Kyles's answer reads "I don't think so.  People should vote in every election because it's a duty of citizens." Mrs. Bosco's answer reads: "You should vote every time there is an election so you can put the right man into office."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert Lee Kyles wearing dark cap and zippered jacket with light colored stripe on collar, standing in front of block wall, Downtown; Portrait of Mrs. Ronald Bosco wearing hat with light colored netting and dark coat with velvet trimmed lapels, standing in front of block wall, Downtown
